intro: Poikilospermum subtrinervium, commonly known as the three-veined poikilospermum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes approximately 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive leaf venation patterns. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape with three prominent veins. Poikilospermum subtrinervium is often found in moist, shaded habitats within forest understories.
